pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [85a868e044](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14882/commits/85a868e044d51d46212cdaec7d1a0d9715be1d15)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.OpenImmersion | 1576 | 1580 | +4 (+0.25%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.ClosedImmersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated`|1|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.OpenImmersion`|4|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UnderlyingMap`|1579|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.IsIso`|1585|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Scheme.Hom.surjective`
`+ Surjective`
`+ Surjective.comp_iff`
`+ Surjective.of_comp`
`+ embedding_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ injective_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ instance (priority := 100) [IsIso f] : Surjective f := ⟨f.homeomorph.surjective⟩`
`+ instance : (topologically Embedding).RespectsIso`
`+ instance : (topologically IsClosedMap).RespectsIso`
`+ instance : (topologically IsOpenMap).RespectsIso`
`+ instance : (topologically OpenEmbedding).RespectsIso`
`+ instance : HasAffineProperty (isomorphisms Scheme) fun X Y f _ ↦ IsAffine X ∧ IsIso (f.app ⊤) := by`
`+ instance : IsLocalAtTarget (isomorphisms Scheme)`
`+ instance : IsLocalAtTarget (stalkwise (fun f ↦ Function.Bijective f)) := by`
`+ instance : MorphismProperty.RespectsIso (topologically Function.Injective)`
`+ instance : MorphismProperty.RespectsIso @Surjective`
`+ instance [Surjective f] [Surjective g] : Surjective (f ≫ g) := ⟨g.surjective.comp f.surjective⟩`
`+ isClosedMap_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ isOpenImmersion_eq_inf`
`+ isOpenMap_iff_isOpenMap_of_iSup_eq_top`
`+ isOpenMap_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ isomorphisms_eq_isOpenImmersion_inf_surjective`
`+ isomorphisms_eq_stalkwise`
`+ mem_top`
`+ openEmbedding_isLocalAtTarget`
`+ surjective_eq_topologically`
`+ surjective_isLocalAtTarget`
`- topologically_isClosedMap_respectsIso`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10007075395/job/27661036880)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10007075395/job/27661036667)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Thanks! LGTM
Thanks! LGTM

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
I think we should have `IsHomeomorphism` and then state this in terms of it, i.e. `isomorphisms Scheme = topologically IsHomeomorphism ⊓ stalkwise (fun f ↦ Function.Bijective f)`.
Hmmm I think `isomorphisms` is exactly this and already has some useful API around it.
But in terms of category theory which does not always play nicely with the type theoretic topology library.
There is #12533 but it seems like a stale PR.
Hm that's sad. Okay, let's merge this one as is and refactor later (or just add the suggested formulation) when we have `IsHomeomorphism`.

I've asked on the relevant Zulip thread whether the author intend to continue and would probably take over if the author has decided to abandon it.
I'll add the suggestion once that PR is merged. I think this lemma is still useful though and I'll probably still keep this.
I am wondering if we should agree on a convention, whether we write `f.val.base` or `f.1.base` or even `f.1.1`. I personally prefer the first version as I think it is the most readable one.

I personally think spelling it out is a good thing but mathlib (or at least I) uses `.1` and `.val` interchangeably so I end up using `f.1.base` most of the time. I don't think the vague `val` gives much information that is worth +2 chars but I'm not against a library-wide replacement if you feel like it.
At least `.val` indicates that it is a subtype where `.1` can really be anything. In any case, this is not important for this PR.

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
of the underlying map of topological spaces, including
```

```suggestion
  have : MorphismProperty.RespectsIso @Surjective := inferInstance
```
I don't know how stable it is to rely on the automatically generated instance name.
(alternatively: give the `RespectsIso` instance a name)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): Being an isomorphism is local at the target.
